title: Demand Paging
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
Never bring a page into memory until it is required. 
Accessing non-resident page triggers **Page Fault** trap. OS pauses process, fetches page from disk, updates table, resumes process.

interview_questions.question: Cost of Page Fault?
interview_questions.answer: Huge. Disk access is milliseconds (10^6 ns). RAM is nanoseconds. Performance killer.
